pixi.core.renderers.webgl.WebGLRenderer

type
class
extends
pixi.core.renderers.SystemRenderer
metadata
:native
"PIXI.WebGLRenderer"

Constructor

new(width : Float, height : Float, ?options : pixi.core.renderers.RenderingOptions)
parameters
[width=0] {number} the width of the canvas view
[height=0] {number} the height of the canvas view
[options] {object} The optional renderer parameters
[options.view] {HTMLCanvasElement} the canvas to use as a view, optional
[options.transparent=false] {boolean} If the render view is transparent, default false
[options.autoResize=false] {boolean} If the render view is automatically resized, default false
[options.antialias=false] {boolean} sets antialias (only applicable in chrome at the moment)
[options.resolution=1] {number} the resolution of the renderer retina would be 2
[options.clearBeforeRender=true] {boolean} This sets if the CanvasRenderer will clear the canvas or not before the new render pass.
[options.preserveDrawingBuffer=false] {boolean} enables drawing buffer preservation, enable this if you need to call toDataUrl on the webgl context.
The WebGLRenderer draws the scene and all its content onto a webGL enabled canvas. This renderer should be used for browsers that support webGL. This Render works by automatically managing webGLBatchs. So no need for Sprite Batches or Sprite Clouds. Don't forget to add the view to your DOM or you will not see anything :)

Instance Variables hide inherited show inherited

autoResize : Bool

inherited from pixi.core.renderers.SystemRenderer
Whether the render view should be resized automatically

backgroundColor : Int

inherited from pixi.core.renderers.SystemRenderer
The background color to fill if not transparent

blendModes : Dynamic

inherited from pixi.core.renderers.SystemRenderer
Tracks the blend modes useful for this renderer.

clearBeforeRender : Bool

inherited from pixi.core.renderers.SystemRenderer
This sets if the CanvasRenderer will clear the canvas or not before the new render pass. If the scene is NOT transparent Pixi will use a canvas sized fillRect operation every frame to set the canvas background color. If the scene is transparent Pixi will use clearRect to clear the canvas every frame. Disable this by setting this to false. For example if your game has a canvas filling background image you often don't need this set.

drawCount : Int

Counter for the number of draws made each frame

height : Float

inherited from pixi.core.renderers.SystemRenderer
The height of the canvas view

preserveDrawingBuffer : Bool

inherited from pixi.core.renderers.SystemRenderer
The value of the preserveDrawingBuffer flag affects whether or not the contents of the stencil buffer is retained after rendering.

inherited from pixi.core.renderers.SystemRenderer
The resolution of the renderer

inherited from pixi.core.renderers.SystemRenderer
Whether the render view is transparent

inherited from pixi.core.renderers.SystemRenderer
